value.title: Facial Recognition Marches Forward, No Matter What Facebook Says
value.excerpt: Facebook parent Meta Platforms Inc. said on Nov. 2 it was shuttering the facial recognition system it used to automatically identify people in images posted to its social network. The company is working to repair a public image crisis—there’s a reason it’s not called Facebook anymore —and facial recognition has become an increasingly toxic concept in many circles.
